intro: Pavonia mattogrossensis var. genuina, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a rough texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
